paragraphs.text: 'Little Hope Was Arson': Why I made a movie about burning churches.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: As the son of missionaries, losing my faith was no small event
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I was 19 and hurting
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My older brother was strung out on a number of drugs
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I had moved in with him naively attempting to help my childhood hero
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: One night he jumped on top of me, wrapped both hands around my throat and had all the rage in his eyes needed to end my life
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he saw that I wasn't struggling
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: he let go, only to wake the next morning and drag me to church
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My brother could threaten my life on Saturday night and, come Sunday morning, lift his hands to Jesus
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: That morning in his church I lost hope in the transformation that supposedly comes with faith
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: On Christmas Day I announced to my father that I no longer wanted to be a Christian
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A few months later, I boarded a ship in New Zealand operated by the medical missions branch of YWAM--Youth with a Mission
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: though I was hardly signing up for six months to serve God
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I was there to prove that God didn't exist
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: One afternoon David Cowie, the head of the program, asked how I was doing
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I spilled my guts
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: At that point every kid who's grown up in a church knows the drill
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I disclose my doubt; he gives the come-back-to-Jesus speech; roll credits
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I reached the end of my story
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: David said nothing
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He sat in silence
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Not the kind of silence that communicates indifference, but the kind that is reserved for close friends sharing a moment of understanding
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He didn't push me away or try to rush my journey with God
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The next few months were transformational, a religious love story
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Like many in my generation, the faith I'd lost inside the four walls of a church was found again through believers who left the sanctuary to help people in need
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I hadn't been persuaded by a man building a congregation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I was undone by a friend who listened without judgment
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: These were the thoughts rattling around in my head when I heard the story of 10 churches in East Texas that had burned to the ground
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Right away I could see the makings of a great crime documentary akin to Errol Morris' "The Thin Blue Line,"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: on a personal level, I also saw a road into my questions about churches
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Ironically it was my brother who encouraged me to start making the film
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: With his help I scraped together enough cash to cover airfare to Texas and a small camera crew
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Then came a few more surprises
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I interviewed pastors mourning the loss of their churches
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I felt a growing sense of sympathy
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Far more than buildings, these people had lost their community homes -- places that heard wedding vows recited and last goodbyes whispered at funerals
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I began to feel sheepishly aware of my own cultural insensitivity
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: After all
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: this was, as many locals put it, "The buckle of the Bible belt."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the more I learned about the two young men who deliberately torched 10 houses of worship, the more I saw of myself
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Jason Bourque and Daniel McAllister had grown up attending Sunday school together
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: family problems and tragedy struck
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: their faith in God stumbled
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they left the church
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But during their time of need, no one was there to listen
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as there had been for me
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "Little Hope Was Arson" ends with a quote from the Spanish anarchist Buenaventura Durruti:"The only church that illuminates is a burning church."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: When a church burns does it simply illuminate the night, or through its destruction will the world see the Gospel shine?
paragraphs.label: assumption
